str2: Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From meros; to part, i.e. to apportion, bestow, share, or to disunite, differ.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular

str2: A tenth part, a tithe. Feminine of dekatos; a tenth, i.e. As a percentage or tithe.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.
A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I translate, explain, (b) I interpret the meaning of. From a presumed derivative of Hermes; to translate.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Then, thereafter, afterwards. From epi and eita; thereafter.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Salem, doubtless identical with Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Salem, a place in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
